The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

results.summary: Tests for leakage identification on Aircraft fluid mechanical installations
results.content: Tests for leakage identification on Aircraft fluid mechanical installations

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The objective of the work is to build dedicated test means (fluid dynamic laboratory) and execute the required tests for confirmation of theoretical simulations, with the final goal of performing eco and reduce cost of fluid dynamic ground tests on aircraft. This call covers the execution of tests on Lab and on demonstrator of IAIR ITD. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.

supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

results.summary: Development and demonstration of materials and manufacturing process for high structural damping composite beams for civil rotor and airframe applications
results.content: Development and demonstration of materials and manufacturing process for high structural damping composite beams for civil rotor and airframe applications

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The research shall provide a manufacturing process capable of producing flight cleared fibre reinforced high strength plastic components characterized by high structural damping through a change of resin system and/or laminating high damping layers on a typical composite structure For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

On 3rd May the third release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

[{"approvalDate":"Jun 1, 2016 5:31:48 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jun 1, 2016 5:31:21 PM","content":"

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:51 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:35 PM","content":"

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.
 

"}]

results.summary: Development of innovative automated fiber placement machine for composite fuselage manufacturing with high performance hybrid materials.
results.content: Development of innovative automated fiber placement machine for composite fuselage manufacturing with high performance hybrid materials.

keywords: New materials: oxides, alloys, composite, organic-
descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Activities described in the present Topic shall contribute to develop and validate an advanced process of hybrid materials automated lay-up for manufacturing of regional aircraft composite fuselage which allows a significant reduction of the overall production costs and manufacturing flow. After a developmental phase to be performed at Partner site, the innovative process and related machine shall be validated and costs assessed through the execution of dedicated lay-up tests and fabrication of fuselage demonstrators at Topic Manager plant. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.

supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

results.summary: Development, fabrication, verification and delivery of innovative and flexible system for automated drilling and fastener insertion on fuselage barrel.
results.content: Development, fabrication, verification and delivery of innovative and flexible system for automated drilling and fastener insertion on fuselage barrel.

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The aim of the present topic is to develop and validate a Flexible system for automated drill of regional aircraft composite fuselage which allows a significant reduction of the overall production costs and flow. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

On 3rd May the third release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme
title: Development, fabrication, verification and delivery of innovative and flexible system for automated drilling and fastener insertion on fuselage barrel.

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

On 1st April the first release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:51 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:35 PM","content":"

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.
 

"}]

results.summary: Optimisation of sensor and associated data acquisition system for blade behaviour
results.content: Optimisation of sensor and associated data acquisition system for blade behaviour

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Blade Tip Timing is a key tool for blade health assessment without any instrumentation on the rotating parts. It is often used for fan and compressor survey in test cell but it is a complex system that is not compatible with an embedded solution or harsh environment.
The aim of this CFP is to strongly improve the current system in order to be able to embedded it in order to monitor all kind of blades during commercial flight. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.

supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme
title: Optimisation of sensor and associated data acquisition system for blade behaviour
callUpdates:
[{"approvalDate":"Jun 1, 2016 5:31:48 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jun 1, 2016 5:31:21 PM","content":"

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

"},{"approvalDate":"Apr 20, 2016 6:22:54 PM","lastChangeDate":"Apr 20, 2016 6:21:26 PM","content":"

On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

On 1st April the first release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:51 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:35 PM","content":"

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.
 

"}]

results.summary: Very high loaded planet bearings enabling technologies
results.content: Very high loaded planet bearings enabling technologies

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Optimization of high load planet bearings dynamic behavior. Higher strength cage material.
Increase of heat transfer capabilities through ceramic rollers and optimization via CFD analysis For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

On 3rd May the third release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

[{"approvalDate":"Jun 1, 2016 5:31:48 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jun 1, 2016 5:31:21 PM","content":"

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:51 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:35 PM","content":"

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.

results.summary: Advanced mechatronics devices for electrical management system of Turboprop
results.content: Advanced mechatronics devices for electrical management system of Turboprop

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

An advanced electrical machine together with the electrical power management will be studied, designed & manufactured. Following partial tests at partner facility, demonstrator hardware will be delivered for engine ground tests. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

On 3rd May the third release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.
 

"}]

results.summary: Advanced Bearings for Turboprop engine
results.content: Advanced Bearings for Turboprop engine

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Development & validation of advanced bearings to address more stressed environments (temperatures, pressures, loads) and more demanding engine configurations. New generation bearings are expected to be developed and manufactured: partial tests and advanced monitoring will be conducted by the partner prior to installation on the engine for ground testing. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

On 3rd May the third release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:51 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:35 PM","content":"

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.
 

"}]

results.summary: Integrated air-oil cooling system
results.content: Integrated air-oil cooling system

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Design & manufacturing of an air-oil engine cooling system to be integrated in the engine bay. Demonstrator hardware will be delivered for engine ground tests. Integration study will be performed to assess the installation. A model for heat management will also be proposed. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

On 3rd May the third release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:51 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:35 PM","content":"

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.

results.summary: Automated full faced measurement of complex geometries
results.content: Automated full faced measurement of complex geometries

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Development of an noncontact sensor to acquire slot geometry of aero engine parts.
The acquired data must represent the slot geometry entirely.
The aim is to reach drawing requirements in the inspection process. Therefore a full faced digitalization is precondition.
Programming of a software tool for an automated feature extraction (shape deviation, displacement), especially form of a surface and comparison with drawing specifications.
Programming of a software interface to transfer automatically measurement data to standardized analytical software.

For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.

supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.
sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:51 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:35 PM","content":"

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.
 

"}]

results.summary: Orbiting Journal Bearing Rig
results.content: Orbiting Journal Bearing Rig

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

To design, build and operate a test rig capable of operating a journal bearing in a rotating field under high loads and speeds. The rig should be used to demonstrate the operational boundaries of journal bearings operating in a rotating field and understand the behaviours for consideration when applied to an epicyclic gear box. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.

supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal
 

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

There is a small clerical error on page 361 of the Call text document:
The Topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-SYS-02-15 “Smart oil pressure sensors for all oil cooled starter/generator” is a SYS topic and not a SAT topic [see “Programme Area” field].


On 20th April the second release of the "Questions & Answers" document was published on this call web site. It is available in the "Additional Documents" section in all topics.

The topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-AIR-02-28 (Development of equipment for composite recycling process of uncured material) was removed from this call.  See the Q&A document for more details.

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:51 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 18, 2016 6:37:35 PM","content":"

On 18th March a new version of Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. the Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was uploaded to reflect the removal of Call topic JTI-CS2-2016-CFP03-FRC-02-16: Electrical Components.

Also on 18th March, the templates for Parts B.I, B.II, C & D for proposals were uploaded to the "Additional Documents" Section of the topics.

"},{"approvalDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:35 PM","lastChangeDate":"Mar 14, 2016 12:59:15 PM","content":"

Please note that the Annex II of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan i.e. Call text presenting the full and formal description of topics was removed and replaced on 14th March: the version published on Friday 11th March was not the correct file.
All candidates are therefore advised to only take into consideration the version dated March 2016 in their application process.

results.summary: Innovations in Titanium investment casting of lightweight structural components for aero engines
results.content: Innovations in Titanium investment casting of lightweight structural components for aero engines

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

In this Topic the limits of the casting process will be challenged and improvements are sought with regard to geometry limitations impacting weight, quality and cost for jet engine structures. Possibilities in the investment casting process will systematically be identified, explored and eventually verified. Examples of technologies range from pattern making and shell/core technology to non-destructive testing and repair. In addition the castability for a range of titanium alloys will be investigated using Ti 6-4 as the reference alloy. The project consortium is anticipated to propose the content of the research and in interaction with the topic manager select specific geometries, alloys and process steps to work on. A range of component sizes are of interest to explore but typical final component weights may range from 20 kg to 100kg. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.

Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2016-01@cleansky.eu

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group:  Contact Points  

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

National Contact Points (NCP) - contact your NCP for further assistance.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

IT Helpdesk- contact the Participant Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Contact the EIT for further assistance related to the call, topics and the content of proposals via the Contact Page on the EIT website.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
The submission system will be available in the first weeks after the call publication. The link will appear here when it is ready. 

In the meantime, all the necessary information to allow you to begin preparing your proposal is available with the call publication here on the Participant Portal.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
           described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals.
     
  4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  5. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).

    Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Multi-Beneficiary
    H2020 Clean Sky 2 JU MGA for Partners - Mono-Beneficiary

  6. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan.
     
  7. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.
     
  8. Background documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Horizon 2020 Rules for Participation
    Horizon 2020 Specific Programme

results.summary: Aerodynamic rigs for VHBR IP Turbine
results.content: Aerodynamic rigs for VHBR IP Turbine

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The work will comprise the aerodynamic rig testing associated to the WP5.2 needed to allow ITP to develop validated technology for the VHBR IP Turbine. Aerodynamic design will be provided by ITP to the partner. The work to be performed by the partner in the CfP comprises detail design (inc. drawings), hardware manufacturing, rig assembly and instrumentation and rig testing. The partner will supply experimental data to ITP to complete technology validation process. The work includes 4 aerodynamic rigs. For the full topic description see the Call Text Document (Annex of Workplan) published with this call.
